name: High Cliffs Watch
role_in_state: sea-approach early-warning and augury beacon network
economy_niches: augury-assisted beacon services and navigational consultancy
emergency ship repair and hull care for small/mid vessels
reagent storage, repackaging and transshipment for ritual use
garrison provisioning and watch-house supply trade
culture_adjustments: sentinel ethos: rotational watch duty overrides clan cycles
ritual practice oriented toward storm-control and beacon rites
guild oversight stricter for augury practitioners and beacon-keepers
hospitality narrowed to maritime travelers and distressed crews
constraints: scarce flat land limits shipyard scale
ritual auguries consume imported reagents and specialized labor
exposed winds restrict large combustion-driven installations
notes: primary early-warning node for State_5 sea lanes
beacon rituals supplement but do not replace charts and seamanship
harbors accommodate only small to mid-sized vessels; transshipment common
